findings.lower_chest: Minimal bibasilar atelectasis. No evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.

abdomen.hepatobiliary: Homogenous attenuation throughout the liver with innumerable hypodensities, largest measuring 2.3 x 1.8 cm in segment VII consistent with cyst. No biliary dilatation.
abdomen.pancreas: Cystic structure arising from the pancreatic tail measuring 2.0 x 1.3 x 1.9 cm. This lesion appears new from the prior exam.
abdomen.spleen: Normal size and attenuation throughout without focal lesions.
abdomen.urinary: Normal kidneys with 1.2 x 1.0 x 1.5 cm intermediate density lesion in the lower pole of the left kidney, and multiple left-sided peripelvic cysts.
abdomen.gastrointestinal: Fat stranding and thickening of the sigmoid colon surrounding multiple diverticuli. No drainable collection, no free air, appendic normal.
abdomen.pelvis: Urinary bladder and distal ureters unremarkable, no free fluid.
abdomen.vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm, mild atherosclerotic disease.
abdomen.bones: No worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture.
abdomen.soft_tissues: Abdominal and pelvic wall within normal limits.

radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Cystic structure in the pancreatic tail appears new from the prior exam.
